channel.title: .dat maybe someone can help?
channel.description:
hi, im not quite sure how to explain this but here goes...
Say i wanted to add in a item or change one, like iceman and galkon have. and ive got the .dat file for it but dont know what to do next. how can i add it to my client? because i know i have to add it there but where and what have i got to do? make it read the .dat file.
~My question~
What do i have to do to make any client read the .dat file so i can see the item on the client, also what do i do to make it a valid item id?
Thanks

item.title: .dat maybe someone can help?
item.dc:creator: @mresi5656 mresi5656
item.description:
@mresi5656 wrote:

look up gzip download on google and navigate to there
My Computer C: Program Files GnuWin32 and Bin.

I copy the .Dat and paste it into Bin and drag the file over Gzip to compress it.
Don’t forget to rename the file to w/e model number you want.gz

Read full topic

item.title: .dat maybe someone can help?
item.dc:creator: @imjammy780 imjammy780
item.description:
@imjammy780 wrote:

ok, should i search on google how to go through the model process or can you give me a file or something to help me out? maybe a thread explaining it?

Thanks for help so far.

Read full topic

item.title: .dat maybe someone can help?
item.dc:creator: @Booniex Booniex
item.description:
@Booniex wrote:

You need to zip it and then add it through model procedures.

Read full topic
